name: THOMAS WESTON ADAMS III
title: Emergency Management Professional | Educator | Public Servant-Leader
statement: I work at the intersection of communication, emergency management, and community service. With over 17 years teaching university-level communication and public speaking, I've equipped future leaders to communicate under pressure. My practical experience includes supervising FEMA's Chemical Stockpile Emergency Preparedness Program closeout at Kentucky Emergency Management (KYEM), supporting SEOC activations, field deployments with a world-class search and rescue team during federally declared disasters, and serving on public information teams for KYEM, FEMA, and SAR operations. Earlier nonprofit work as director of communications complements this foundation in strategic, audience-centered messaging, program oversight, and public service.
emergencyHighlights: Supervise staff and volunteers in high-risk emergency preparedness environment
Write, update, and implement all-hazards emergency plans and site-specific response plans
Coordinate multi-agency emergency responses with law enforcement, fire, public health, and military
Develop and deliver emergency preparedness training, drills, and exercises
Manage FEMA-funded programs and ensure federal grant compliance (2 CFR 200, FAR 31.2)
Serve as primary point of contact for emergency management initiatives and EOC activations
Apply de-escalation, trauma-informed communication, and restorative practices
emergencyContent:
Kentucky Emergency Management (May 2023 – Present): Section Supervisor overseeing Chemical Stockpile Emergency Preparedness Program (CSEPP) stewardship and drawdown. Serve on State EOC team during activations in multiple roles: Planning Section Chief, Field Operations, Logistics, Public Safety Branch, and ESF5 Emergency Management Support Function. FEMA-funded position requiring high-level coordination with federal, state, and local partners including U.S. Army and National Guard.

Wolfe County Search & Rescue (January 2021 – Present): Officer, Treasurer, and Finance Officer for 501(c)(3) nonprofit. Active team member with certifications as Wilderness First Responder, Rope Rescue Technician, and Swift Water/Moving Water Rescue Technician. FEMA National Incident Management System (ICS) certified. Responded to Eastern Kentucky floods (2022) and numerous search operations.
educationHighlights: Award-Winning Teacher: Critical Thinking Teacher of the Year Nominee (2015), Teacher Who Made a Difference Award (2014)
Technology Mentor & Advocate: Pearson Higher Ed Faculty Advisor, integrated learning technologies across institutions
Public Speaking & Conflict Management: 2x National Qualifier in competitive speech and debate (high school)
De-escalation & Trauma-Informed Communication: Applied with vulnerable populations, disaster survivors, and community members in crisis
Change Management: Led teams through new policies, systems, and operational transitions
educationContent:
17+ Years of University-Level Teaching: Taught at 10+ institutions including Ohio Northern University (Visiting Assistant Professor), Texas A&M University (Full-time Faculty), Bluegrass Community & Technical College (Communications Area Faculty), University of Kentucky, Penn State, San Diego State, and internationally at Shanghai University. Designed curricula, mentored faculty, and coached hundreds of students through challenging communication scenarios.

Published Author & Award Winner: Author of "Memes as a Communicative Act" in Meme Life (2021), which won the National Communication Association Book Award (2023). Research Partner on Towers of Rhetoric: Memory and Reinvention (2018). Keynote speaker and presenter at national conferences.
publicServiceHighlights: Manage organizational financial reporting, reconciliation, and audit preparation
Oversee grant-funded initiatives, track expenditures, and document performance for funders
Prepare comprehensive financial reports with visual data presentation
Ensure regulatory compliance and financial accountability across public and nonprofit sectors
Build and maintain relationships with law enforcement, fire, public health, human services, volunteer organizations, and military partners
publicServiceContent:
Federal Grants Management Certificate: Completed comprehensive training in Subawarding for Pass-through Entities, Cost Principles (2 CFR 200 and FAR 31.2), Writing Successful Federal Grants, and Uniform Administrative Requirements for Federal Grants.

Nonprofit Leadership Experience: Currently serve as Treasurer & Finance Officer for Wolfe County Search & Rescue (501c3). Previously Executive Director and Interim President of Friends of Hemp (2019–2020), and Communication Director for Hemp Feed Coalition (2019–2020). Candidate for State Representative, Kentucky House District 73 (2022).
